q: It was meant to point out there was broad support in Eastern Europe and that France and Germany did not speak for the entire continent. "Ironically, my comment was unintentional," Donald Rumsfeld writes. I had meant to say France and Germany represented "old NATO' not` old Europe.' be planning to do will affect Rochester directly. Barack Obama Kirsten Gillibrand really hopes to hear that the research and development tax credit will be made permanent. She said that could bring many jobs here to Rochester. What that tax credit is about is it allows businesses that are innovators, entrepreneurial businesses like a lot of the businesses in Rochester to invest in research in development and get a credit for that investment. So really it makes a difference in creating jobs, particularly in growing industries like high tech, bio-tech, energy technology, optical technology all of that work that we do in Rochester would really benefit greatly from an R&D tax credit that's permanent. More than anything else I have failed to do," he writes, and even amid my pride in the many important things that we did accomplish, I regret that I did not leave at that point. Fans of Washington insider politics, meanwhile, will find plenty to chew over. Donald Rumsfeld does not hesitate to dish on the personal squabbles that plagued the President Bush administration.
